description: A comprehensive Grafana dashboard for monitoring Redis instances using Prometheus. This dashboard visualizes key metrics related to performance, memory, clients, keys, and replication.

panels.description: Redis Version
panels.title: Redis Version

panels.description: Check if the max memory feature is enabled in the configuration
panels.title: MaxMemory Enabled?

panels.description: Per node uptime
panels.title: Uptime

panels.description: Represents the configured number of IO threads per instance
panels.title: IO Threads Per Instance

panels.description: number of nodes running the corresponding mode
panels.title: Nodes

panels.description: When the maximum memory is reached, the configured policy will be applied.
panels.title: Eviction Policy

panels.description: Hit rate shows the percentage of key space lookups that hit a key.
panels.title: Hit ratio per instance

panels.description: Error replies that Redis sent to clients because of wrong commands, or internal error.
panels.title: Error Replies From Redis Instances

panels.description: Represents the maximum memory usage these instances have reached.
panels.title: Peak Memory Usage Per Instance
Average TTL for the Expired Keys

panels.description: The percentage of keys that are probably expired.
panels.title: Expired Keys Percentage

panels.description: When the Maxmemory is reached, Redis will start the eviction according to the configured eviction policy.
panels.title: Key Evictions

panels.description: When the maximum number of allowed clients is reached, New clients will be blocked
panels.title: Blocked Clients Per Instance

panels.description: Redis allocates an output buffer for every client connection. When a client is slow to read responses, the buffer starts filling up with pending data, which can grow until the client either catches up or exceeds the configured buffer limit.
panels.title: Clients Max Reached Output Buffer

panels.description: Redis allocates an input buffer for every client connection. When a client sends large commands or pipelines many commands at once, the buffer accumulates incoming data until Redis processes it, which can grow significantly depending on the workload.
panels.title: Clients Max Reached Input Buffer

panels.description: When the client remains idle for a period greater than the configured time, then he will be added to the timeout table.
panels.title: Timeout Clients

panels.description: Number Of Shards in the Cluster
panels.title: Cluster Shards

panels.description: Number of masters in the cluster
panels.title: Masters

panels.description: Number of slaves in the cluster
panels.title: Slaves

panels.description: Number of communication messages sent by the corresponding cluster node.
panels.title: Cluster Bus Outgoing Communication Messages

panels.description: Number of communication messages sent by the corresponding cluster node.
panels.title: Cluster Bus Incoming Communication Messages

panels.description: Number of slots assigned to cluster nodes.
panels.title: Cluster Assigned Slots

panels.description: number of slaves per master
panels.title: Connected Slaves

panels.description: number of slaves per master
panels.title: Connected Slaves Lag in Seconds

panels.description: number of accepted partial rsync using the backlog buffer
panels.title: Accepted Partial Resync

panels.description: number of accepted partial rsync using the backlog buffer
panels.title: Denied Partial Resync

panels.description: number of accepted full rsync using the backlog buffer
panels.title: Accepted Full Replication

panels.description: What is the latency value that the 99% of requests are faster than?
panels.title: P99 Quantile
AOF Delayed Fsync Due to OS

title: The Ultimate Redis Dashboard
